content: What Makes You Think You Can Race Against Horses?
Why do bad people have it so good?
You planted them and they put down roots.
They talk as if they’re old friends with you,
Meanwhile, you know  inside and out.
Make them pay for the way they live,
How long do we have to put up with this—
And all because of wickedness, these wicked lives?
Because they’ll have nothing to do with God
“So, Jeremiah, if you’re worn out in this footrace with men,
And if you can’t keep your wits during times of calm,
Those closest to you, your own brothers and cousins,
They’re out to get you. They’ll stop at nothing.
“I will abandon the House of Israel,
I will turn over those I most love
She’s been, this one I held dear,
Growling and baring her teeth at me—
Has this one I hold dear become a preening peacock?
Then invite all the hungry animals at large,
Foreign, scavenging shepherds
Turn my beautiful, well-cared-for fields
They leave them littered with junk—
The whole countryside is a wasteland,
“The barbarians will invade,
The judgment sword of  will take its toll
They will plant wheat and reap weeds.
They will look at their meager crops and wring their hands.

’s Message: “Regarding all the bad neighbors who abused the land I gave to Israel as their inheritance: I’m going to pluck them out of their lands, and then pluck Judah out from among them. Once I’ve pulled the bad neighbors out, I will relent and take them tenderly to my heart and put them back where they belong, put each of them back in their home country, on their family farms. Then if they will get serious about living my way and pray to me as well as they taught my people to pray to that god Baal, everything will go well for them. But if they won’t listen, then I’ll pull them out of their land by the roots and cart them off to the dump. Total destruction!” ’s Decree.
